metadata.title: CVE-2017-11450 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
coders/jpeg.c in ImageMagick before 7.0.6-1 allows remote attackers tocause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly have unspecifiedother impact via JPEG data that is too short.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11450` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
imagemagick-common - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
libmagick++5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
libmagickcore5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
libmagickcore5-extra - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
libmagickwand5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
perlmagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8').
